posts.post_content:
I have 1 George wiltse if interested in a trade


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
Sean, I have quite a few - all are listed on ebay - I can give you a fantastic group deal.

Hey Sean,

Have a bunch as well - [url]http://imageevent.com/gspinf/forsaletrade[/url] - think there are 30 or so that were on your list in the other thread.

Mike

Mine are no longer available. Never got a response from Sean here or in pm so guessing he has disappeared

Sent from my SM-G730V using Tapatalk

[quote name="Runscott" post=1312399]Mine are no longer available. Never got a response from Sean here or in pm so guessing he has disappeared

Sent from my SM-G730V using Tapatalk[/QUOTE]

I posted on the other thread... I will edit this one out
I picked up a group of 140 misc and need to wait until they get here to update the list...

I didn't see any other thread.  This is the non-T206 'T' card sub-forum, so I don't know where such a thread would be.

But this does bring up something that irks me every now and then on this forum.  I can understand the lack of response to ebay questions, especially ridiculously-low offers on things, but Net 54 members are supposedly a bit more socialized.  I don't think it should be that difficult to respond to PM's or emails regarding potential deals.  If one person goes to the trouble to make you an offer, you could at least respond with "no thanks".  If not, you can be fairly assured that you won't have to deal with opening any pesky PM's or emails from the sender in the future.

[quote name="Runscott" post=1312696]I didn't see any other thread.  This is the non-T206 'T' card sub-forum, so I don't know where such a thread would be.

But this does bring up something that irks me every now and then on this forum.  I can understand the lack of response to ebay questions, especially ridiculously-low offers on things, but Net 54 members are supposedly a bit more socialized.  I don't think it should be that difficult to respond to PM's or emails regarding potential deals.  If one person goes to the trouble to make you an offer, you could at least respond with "no thanks".  If not, you can be fairly assured that you won't have to deal with opening any pesky PM's or emails from the sender in the future.[/QUOTE]

I'm sorry I didn't respond back as quick as you would have liked - but I need to wait until this other lot comes in.

My internet has been out and is out right now and will not be back up until some time at 8 PM tomorrow when the service guy gets out here... Working from my phone is rather difficult and I miss things. I can't do much more than say sorry.

edit - simple tasks are taking me 10 times as long because I am using my phones connection and have no keyboard

Sean, it's fine.  This just reminded me of several 'no response' situations that have come up over the last few months.  My thinking was that it's possible forum members just aren't aware that they should respond, even if they are NOT interested in something.  I had a roommate in college who, if asked a question, would sometimes respond: "I don't care".  I was always disturbed by that.

Regarding the cards - I have sold most of those T207's on ebay over the last few days, which is weird as they had been sitting around for months.  The offer I made you via PM was my cost + shipping.  It's still good for the remainder, but there aren't many left.
